subsections.title: Overview
highlights: First national park in the world, established in 1872
Located in Wyoming, Montana, and Idaho
Known for geysers, wildlife, canyons, and volcanic history

subsections.title: Top Attractions
highlights: Old Faithful – erupts ~every 90 minutes
Grand Prismatic Spring – vivid colors, large hot spring
Yellowstone Lake – largest alpine lake in North America
Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone – dramatic falls and views
Mammoth Hot Springs – terraces and historic Fort Yellowstone

subsections.title: Wildlife Watching
highlights: Lamar Valley – best for wolves and bison
Hayden Valley – grizzlies, elk, and waterfowl
Black bears often seen near Tower-Roosevelt
Early morning and dusk are prime viewing times
Always stay 100 yards from bears/wolves, 25 yards from others

subsections.title: Hiking & Trails
highlights: Fairy Falls – 5-mile roundtrip to waterfall and Prismatic overlook
Uncle Tom’s Trail – steep stair descent to Lower Falls
Mt. Washburn – panoramic summit views
Yellowstone River Picnic Area Trail – wildlife and river vistas
Mystic Falls via Biscuit Basin – great thermal/hiking combo

subsections.title: Lodging & Campgrounds
highlights: Old Faithful Inn – historic lodge with geyser views
Canyon Lodge – central base with modern amenities
Grant Village – near Yellowstone Lake
Madison, Pebble Creek, and Slough Creek – top campgrounds
Book early: reservations open 6–13 months out

subsections.title: Geothermal & Geology
highlights: Over 10,000 geothermal features in the park
Geysers, hot springs, mud pots, and fumaroles
Sits atop a supervolcano caldera
Norris Geyser Basin – hottest, most active thermal area
Always stay on boardwalks – thermal areas can be deadly

subsections.title: Seasonal Tips & Closures
highlights: Spring: wildlife birthing season, some roads closed
Summer: busiest, all roads open, book early
Fall: elk rutting season, fewer crowds
Winter: snowcoach access, wolves easier to see
Check NPS alerts for road and weather conditions

subsections.title: Activities & Tours
highlights: Guided hikes, wildlife tours, photography workshops
Boating & paddling on Yellowstone Lake (permit required)
Horseback rides and stagecoach experiences at Roosevelt
Junior Ranger programs for kids
Fishing – permit required, catch-and-release zones

subsections.title: Park Rules & Safety
highlights: No cannabis – Yellowstone is federal land
Bear spray strongly recommended – know how to use it
No drones, no feeding wildlife
Pack out all trash – Leave No Trace
Respect thermal zones and posted warnings

subsections.title: Loop Integration & Travel Tips
highlights: Plan 4–7 days to fully explore all regions
Stay in multiple locations for less driving
Avoid peak hours (10AM–4PM) at top attractions
Bring layers – temps vary wildly
Gas up often – stations are limited inside the park
